alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Johnston; Sampson; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 2:43PM EDT until July 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Johnston, Sampson and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of urban areas, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 242 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, with accumulations of around 2 inches in an hour or less. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Goldsboro, Clinton, Mount Olive, Fremont, Walnut Creek, Godwin, Hope Mills, Eastover, Pine Level, Kenly, Princeton, Roseboro, Stedman, Pikeville, Newton Grove, Wade, Salemburg, Turkey and Falcon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
